meanings.definition: A rod or bar that radiates from the hub of a wheel and supports the rim.
meanings.sent1: The bicycle wheel had shiny spokes that connected the center to the edge.
meanings.sent2: She counted the spokes on the wagon wheel to make sure none were missing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the spokes of the wheel as monkey bars.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like spokes on a wheel, all leading back to the central theme.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the silver spokes, creating a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.definition: One of the bars or rungs in a ladder.
meanings.sent1: Hold onto the spokes tightly as you climb up the ladder.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter ascended the ladder, gripping each spoke with determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the ladder's spokes were a fun challenge to climb.
meanings.sent4: Each spoke of the ladder represented a step closer to reaching the top.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden ladder creaked as he placed his weight on the spokes.

meanings.definition: A radial member of a wheel, joining the hub to the rim.
meanings.sent1: The wheel's spokes were carefully crafted to ensure stability.
meanings.sent2: The car mechanic tightened the spokes to prevent any wobbling.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to use the wheel's spokes as a makeshift hammock.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between them acted as the spokes of a wheel, connecting them.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted intricate designs on each of the wheel's spokes.
